name: G7 Decontamination
intro: The learning document for this test is at G7 Decontamination Procedures and G7 Decontamination Policy in the FENZ Portal (requires to login with your FENZ account)

structure.description: Which agency is responsible for the decontamination of members of the public?
options: Police
FENZ
Ambulance Service

structure.description: What must be in place before firefighters enter a hot zone?
options: Preparations for emergency decontamination are in place
Firefighters are wearing barrier gloves and a dust mask.
Consideration has been given to requesting resources for deliberate decontamination
Gas detector has been set up to identify the hazardous material.
Hazardous material has been identified
correctAnswer: Preparations for emergency decontamination are in place
Consideration has been given to requesting resources for deliberate decontamination

structure.description: What other agency may be required to assist with the decontamination of a person who poses a threat to FENZ personnel?
options: Defence Force personnel
Ambulance Service
Police

structure.description: Emergency Decontamination is to be used when there is a need to decontaminate before deliberate decontamination equipment can arrive. eg, medical emergency or life risk.
Emergency Decontamination is to be used when there is a need to decontaminate before deliberate decontamination equipment can arrive. eg, medical emergency or life risk.
options: The personnel to be decontaminated must be wearing BA with a Splash suit, Gas Suit or other agency equivalent.Option 1
Members of the public wearing permeable clothing (liquids/gas can pass through) that has been contaminated.
The personnel to be decontaminated must be wearing a minimum of structure gear and BA
The contaminant must be water-miscible and safely diluted and directed into a drain or sewer.
correctAnswer: The personnel to be decontaminated must be wearing BA with a Splash suit, Gas Suit or other agency equivalent.Option 1
Members of the public wearing permeable clothing (liquids/gas can pass through) that has been contaminated.

structure.description: What factors determine whether the decontamination corridor should be used?
options: People are wearing permeable clothing (liquids/gas can pass through)
FENZ personnel wearing Structural Firefighting PPE
Firefighters in Gas Tight suits that have been contaminated.
There is no Portaflex shower available
The contaminant is immiscible in water (does not mix or dissolve) or there is a need to contain the run-off
correctAnswer: There is no Portaflex shower available
The contaminant is immiscible in water (does not mix or dissolve) or there is a need to contain the run-off

structure.description: Who decides whether the run-off from a decontamination procedure should be contained?
options: Pump operator
OIC
HAZCHEM or specialist advice
Police

structure.description: Which of these are NOT key responsibilities of the Decontamination Officer
options: Managing the decontamination function on the incident ground
Reporting to the Fire Logistics Commander
Ensuring crews have adequate rest and refreshment
Assigning tasks to personnel to assist with the decontamination process
Identifying safety issues and hazards on the incident ground
Ensure all decontamination forms are completed
correctAnswer: Ensuring crews have adequate rest and refreshment
Identifying safety issues and hazards on the incident ground

structure.description:
The OIC HazMat /Command vehicle is responsible for ensuring the safe and appropriate
recommissioning of all decontamination equipment.
Which of these are the OIC Fire’s responsibilities?
options: Ensuring that all SHEP forms are completed during the decontamination process
Ensuring FENZ personnel carrying out decontamination during an incident follow the requirements of the HazMat policy
Appointing a Decontamination Officer whenever the decontamination corridor is in use or as required
Ensuring that the hazardous material is removed from the site to a place of safety
correctAnswer: Ensuring FENZ personnel carrying out decontamination during an incident follow the requirements of the HazMat policy
Appointing a Decontamination Officer whenever the decontamination corridor is in use or as required
